thread.title: Trump's intern "apologizes"; Huckabee attacks Clinton
thread.title_full: Trump's intern "apologizes"; Huckabee attacks Clinton - CBS News

author: CBS News
title: Trump's intern "apologizes"; Huckabee attacks Clinton
text:
From the 2016 presidential candidates on Oct. 22, 2015: 
Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks during a campaign rally at the Treasure Island Hotel & Casino on October 8, 2015 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Isaac Brekken/Getty Images 
Donald Trump says his intern is sorry for social media faux pas: 

The young intern who accidentally did a Retweet apologizes.
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 22, 2015 
The Republican contender was referring to a Tweet his account had reposted from a user earlier in the day. The post implied that Iowa voters -- a majority of whom have started to favor Ben Carson , according to a recent poll -- had incurred brain damage from eating genetically modified corn:

The original tweet was later deleted from Trump's account.
Mike Huckabee pokes fun at Clinton during Benghazi testimony: 
U.S. Republican presidential candidate and former Governor Mike Huckabee speaks at the North Texas Presidential Forum hosted by the Faith & Freedom Coalition and Prestonwood Baptist Church in Plano, Texas October 18, 2015. REUTERS 
As former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton testifies in front of the House Select Committee on Benghazi, former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee sharpened his attacks against the Democratic presidential candidate on Twitter.

Better odds: @HillaryClinton telling the truth in her #BenghaziCommittee testimony or that Nigerian prince wiring me money? #Benghazi 
— Gov. Mike Huckabee (@GovMikeHuckabee) October 22, 2015 
. @HillaryClinton giving candid assessment on #Benghazi as likely as @RealDonaldTrump & Rosie O'Donnell paddle-boating the Potomac together
— Gov. Mike Huckabee (@GovMikeHuckabee) October 22, 2015 
. @HillaryClinton coming clean to #BenghaziCommittee seeming abt as likely as me getting a Che Guevara tattoo on small of my back! #Benghazi 
— Gov. Mike Huckabee (@GovMikeHuckabee) October 22, 2015
